result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher Walter Briggs

records.addlTxt: No contact with A.M. The above no contact may have the exception of third party contact for purposes of property removal.

11:03 AM Defendant Christopher Walter Briggs in court, in custody.  Attorney Lance Morgan Nelsen in court for Christopher Walter Briggs.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney acknowledges receipt of the information, waives a formal reading, enters a plea of not guilty and requests status. Notes that the defendant has posted bail and is sitting a sentence in another case. Defendant will seek assessments when released. Asks for status in late November or early December. State has no objection. Parties indicate there is a no contact in the bond. Attorney Nelsen notes that there is property at the residence of the victim. State is not opposed to third party contact for purposes of property retrieval.
Status conference scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 11:00 am.
